Static Gift Bag Test

A Test Site Based on David Efhan's Static Gift Bag

A HTML + CSS + JS base front-end starter for simple web site projects modified from David Efhan (@frzrbox)'s Static Gift Bag.

Key Features

  • NPM & Parcel Based

    Super simple and fast way to setup a local dev environment to get up and running. Just npm install to get setup and npm run dev to spin up a local server and you are all set to go. SASS support included.

  • Page Transitions via Swup.js

    Super simple way to get up and running with page transitions based on css animation (no javascript libraries needed, like GSAP required, and fully customizable via css).

  • Scroll Animations via Lax.js

    Super simple way to get up and running with scroll-triggered animations using data attribute presets at very little cost (3K). No need to write a custom JS solution with custom @keyframe css solutions for common effects like fade in and fade out.

  • Utility Classes

    Simple set of go-to utility classes, such as .centered-block (for quick horizontal and vertically centering) and .auto-grid (for a super simple way to laying out content without excessive grid markup).

  • So Much More!

    David included a bunch of his go-to solutions, such as his parallax-pg plugin, custom cursors, and event-group data-attributes for adding click events in the markup (no Javascript required). Super Cool. Thanks David!

Mad Props to David Efhan (@frzrbox)!

Go check out his staticGiftBag repo and demo site now for more details.
